website_summaries.verdict: Long-time Kirby fans will face many surprises as you race to rescue King Dedede, including devious puzzles, giant bosses, and tons of nostalgic keychains to find.
pros: New abilities like Poison, Beetle, and Hypernova
Fun mini-games like Dedede’s Drum Dash

customer_reviews.title: Three times the games inside, not all are equal.
customer_reviews.text: It's not Nightmare in Dreamland but the story of Triple Deluxe is fun, fast, and leaves room to re-explore stages for secrets after beating the level. The mini games actually steal a lot of the thunder away from the main campaign here and are a lot of fun to play with friends. Though, after a few play throughs the minigames begin to show their shallow nature. Once you beat this there isn't a whole lot to return too, though.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Pisko

customer_reviews.title: Kirby Finally Jump Into First 3D Handheld Game
customer_reviews.text: In the past, handheld Kirby games were mostly involve 2D-style platform for over two decades. In 2014, that would change with Kirby Triple Deluxe. Kirby's first 3DS game contains (1) Story (2) Music/Rhythm and (3) Battle Mode. Story Mode: Clever plot, great dynamic change with background and foreground, awesome new copy abilities, and cool boss battles Music/Rhythm: Good song selections and remixes, and unique gameplay Battle Mode: Fantastic arenas, wonderful selection of copy abilities, and fun chaotic matches Overall, the entire package is stunning and perfect. Triple Deluxe is the best Kirby game I ever enjoy. Die-hard fans must recommend this 3DS title.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Kirby Love!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it in the mail and what can I say, its everything you expect Kirby to be :) If you love the older games, this one is no exception to the rules. A tiny bit of a learning curb to relearn on a 3DS but I hardly notice it. It plays every bit like the originals with a fresh twist and new moves, who doesn't love to see the little marshmallow literally eat everything on the screen? My biggest concern was visibility on a tiny little screen compared to the tv but it holds up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: My first 3ds game
customer_reviews.text: So much fun! The levels have so much depth and the graphics and colors are great. It's fairly easy to beat the game. But you can make it last longer by trying to collect all the secret items to get a 100% completion rating.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Love it.....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 9 year old granddaughter. This was at the top of her list in the Kirby adventures. So much so, her brother, 11, requested it as well, so they now play it together. These are A student children, so I would say this DS game captures their attention and ability for detail, yet fun. Keeps them very occupied when then are playing it together. Grammy is 70, so I have no idea why? LOL
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Got as a gift for my daughter and she loves it. Always a Kirby fan and passing it on to my kids.
customer_reviews.author: alphaBAZINGA

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, but there are *way* too many moves per form, and it gets old fast. Overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Probably my favorite Kirby game out of the handful I've played
customer_reviews.text: Probably my favorite Kirby game out of the handful I've played. The art is fun and colorful and there's plenty of copy abilities for you to try out. Game play is relatively easy at the start but spikes in difficulty towards the end. It should keep you occupied for a while if you go for 100% completion. If you haven't played a Kirby game yet and are interested in a good beginner 2D platformer, pick this game up.
customer_reviews.author: texas.tiel

customer_reviews.title: Since When are Kirby Games This Short?
customer_reviews.text: Stick this on a dual cartridge with Planet Robobot and you've got a full title there.
customer_reviews.author: Nunya Biznes

customer_reviews.title: Gifted
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift - I believe they enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A let your hair down and just have fun game
customer_reviews.text: My sons (me too) are game fanatics and Kirby has always been one of the favorites. A must have for our collection. Fun and entertaining, no matter what age. It's great to have games that are just fun to play without all the teen/mature drama. Keep up the good work Nintendo.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon J Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, great content
customer_reviews.text: I played this game before and decided to order it from amazon. Never received my package but amazon took care of it. But the game content is great and the 3D is pretty good too. I am a big kirby fan and this game is a huge step from the other kirby games I have played.
customer_reviews.author: Davey Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great, but typical
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for someone, but I purchased it for myself some time ago and while it's a great addition to the Kirby series, there's not much in the way of deviation from the usual formula here. Still, I highly recommend this as a really fun game to play!
customer_reviews.author: ShyGuy

customer_reviews.title: More Kirby, what more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit that I haven't had the opportunity to play a lot of Kirby games and the first ones that I played were for the original GameBoy but this one has been exceptional. Lots of levels, tons of power-ups and a final boss battle that was unexpected, challenging and fun. If you like Kirby even the tiniest bit, I suggest giving this one ago.
customer_reviews.author: Halderis

customer_reviews.title: Classic Kirby!
customer_reviews.text: Kirby Triple Deluxe is a great game so far! I've played through three levels in the first world and so far I'm loving it. The only other Kirby game I've played is Amazing Mirror (GBA); The controls are almost identical which is great. The only bad thing I can think about is that Deluxe Kirby seems a tad bit slower-moving than Mirror Kirby, but really that's it. Music, graphics, and colors are all fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Freeturtle132

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any handheld collection.
customer_reviews.text: Game arrived earlier than I expected and without a scratch. The game seems free of bugs and is a more than fair challenge. The first level eased me into the game's mechanics without holding my hand too much.
customer_reviews.author: JoeMavro

customer_reviews.title: What a fun little game
customer_reviews.text: What a fun little game. The mechanics are simple, lots of power ups, and just really fun to play. Sometimes games don't have to be super hard to enjoy them.
customer_reviews.author: Chong Y Yi

customer_reviews.title: A great game not to hard not to easy don't listen ...
customer_reviews.text: A great game not to hard not to easy don't listen to the people that say it's to easy because they are grown ups that don't have lives and this game is kids which I am
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old loved it. It seemed pretty short, but he's also played the others, so maybe he just got really good at Kirby games. He did have some other things to do after completing the game, so I guess that adds more game time.
customer_reviews.author: SE

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Kirby platforming
customer_reviews.text: Another brilliant Kirby platformer. This game, as with all Kirby entries, is not about challenge, but rather empowerment. It makes the player feel good about playing it. All of the classic gameplay elements are here from copy abilities to flying, all with an addrd sheen of beautiful 3D effects. One of the best looking and most effective uses of 3D on the system. An essential title for all owners of the 3DS.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Cuteness overload
customer_reviews.text: It is really entertaining, perfect for kids or adults. Nice graphics and a lot of Kirby cuteness. Definitely recommended. You will enjoy it very much!
customer_reviews.author: Daniela Avendaño

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Charming classic Kirby game with fun and relaxing platforming action and with a REALLY good soundtrack. It also include 2 extra mode that are basically fun mini games. Recommend to any gamer who enjoy platforming and action games.

customer_reviews.title: The little creampuff that could
customer_reviews.text: 3 games in one, Huge campaign, Kirby fighters similar to Smash bros, and DeDeDe mini music game all in one small little creampuff. Whats not to like, also great 3d that pops into the screen like Mario 3ds and Donkey Kong 3ds.

customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my adult son who is attending collage for a degree in game design. He loved it!

product_meta.title: Kirby Triple Deluxe - Nintendo 3DS
product_meta.description:
Feel the beat in Dedede’s Drum Dash
View larger Pink? Check. Puffy? Check. Powerful? You have no idea. Devour trees, obstacles, and huge chunks of stages with Kirby’s Hypernova ability and inhale enemies to copy epic new moves like Archer. It’s a grand new Kirby adventure PLUS a new multiplayer battle mode, Kirby Fighters!*

When a mysterious being kidnaps King Dedede atop a giant Dreamstalk, only Kirby can save the day! Jump from the foreground to the background in dynamic 3D side-scrolling environments while using new and returning copy abilities to defeat enemies. Duke it out in Kirby Fighters, a fierce 4-player* battle mode where you fight using a chosen ability like Sword or Ninja. The last Kirby standing reigns supreme. Whether you’re new to Kirby or an old fan, the Kirby: Triple Deluxe game offers a triple threat—action, adventure, and a battle mode.

KEY FEATURES:
 * Kirby's powerful copy ability returns, allowing him to inhale, spit and transform 
 * Jump from the foreground to the background in dynamic 3D side-scrolling levels
 * Employ new and returning abilities, including:
   Archer - Kirby wields a bow to strike silently from a distance
   Beetle - Kirby grabs foes with his horn and slams them into the ground
   Fire - Kirby can roll into a fireball and scorch through the air
   Sword - Kirby dons a green cap and wields a sword 
 * Kirby’s new Hypernova ability lets him inhale obstacles and big chunks of levels! 
 * Use the Download Play feature to duke it out in Kirby Fighters, a fierce battle mode for up to 4 players*! You can also sharpen your skills by playing solo 
 * Enjoy a selection of additional game modes including Dedede’s Drum Dash and Arena 
 * Collect hidden keychains in every level, each resembling legacy Kirby characters 
 * Unlock improved items and new keychains by using the StreetPass function to tag other players 

*Additional systems are required for multiplayer mode; sold separately.

Initiate Kirby’s new Hypernova ability to inhale anything in your path
View larger New 3D gameplay allows you to jump between the background and foreground as you make your way through each level
View larger Up to 4 friends can face-off in this fierce all Kirby battle mode
View larger Kirby’s classic sword-wielding ability is back for this quest to save King Dedede
View larger Inhale enemies with Kirby’s Hypernova abilities
View larger
feature_bullets: Kirby's powerful copy ability returns, allowing him to inhale, spit and transform.
Jump from the foreground to the background in dynamic 3D side-scrolling levels.
Kirbys new Hypernova ability lets him inhale obstacles and big chunks of levels!
Use the Download Play feature to duke it out in Kirby Fighters, a fierce battle mode for up to 4 players!
Enjoy a selection of additional game modes including Dededes Drum Dash and Arena.
